trend_summary: 1990-2020 imagery shows steady forest clearance giving way to dispersed cropland and pasture. Agricultural mosaics spread outward from river bends and along new roads, while hamlets enlarged only marginally. Built-up surfaces remain scarce; landscape stays dominantly rural and vegetated despite accelerating deforestation.
notable_changes: Forest cover shrank markedly, especially along the central eastâ€“west corridor and meandering river terraces.
Patchwork of light-coloured fields expanded, indicating intensified cropland and pasture conversion.
Road network became denser, creating access spurs to newly cleared parcels.
Small settlements enlarged slightly but did not coalesce into continuous urban fabric.
